description.narrative: The development objective of the proposed project is to improve overall health system stewardship and financing, and enhance equitable access to, and technical and perceived quality of essential healthcare services, in the selected districts in a fiscally responsible and sustainable manner with a view to improving health outcomes.

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

condition.narrative: Furnish architectural plan, environmental assessment and management plan for healthcare facilities before commencing works.

title.narrative: Proportion of sick people seeking healthcare increased.

comment.narrative: % of people with acute conditions seeking health care: 28.9% and 23.8% in pilot and control districts, respectively (36.2% and28.4% regular care for chronic conditions). (according to USAID 2006)
Increased proportion of sick people seeking healthcare

Achieved. According to the M&E of the national master plan implementation results, there has been an increase in out-patient careseeking behavior from 4 in 2006 to 4.3 patient visits to PHC per capita in 2010.

title.narrative: Output based budgeting for health facilities in project districts designed and piloted

comment.narrative: Budgetary allocations done on the basis of historical budgets estimated largely on the basis of existing facilities and personnel.This indicator was introduced during the midterm review w/out formal restructuring)

target.value: Output based budgeting designed and piloted

actual.value: Output based budgeting designed but not piloted

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. operational plan for the MHI included a detailed roadmap of required institutional and legislative changes,piloting activities necessary for the introduction of MHI. Options were delineated in the documents regarding out-put budgeting forPHC. In addition, a new case-based hospital payment mechanism was developed (DRG), which is ready for piloting.

title.narrative: Public expenditures on health gradually increased to a sustainable level that would ensure full coverage of the population with basic package of services.

comment.narrative: In 2005, public expenditures on health was 0.97% of the GDP or 4 % of the consolidated state budget. Overall it accounted for38%oftotal health expenditures. Public private ratio = 40:60. In 2005, public expenditures on health was 0.97% of the GDP or 4 %of theconsolidated state budget. Overall it accounted for 38% of total health expenditures. Public private ratio = 40:60.
Public exp. on health increased
Achieved. Public health spending has increased from 168.9 million manats in 2006 to 609.4 million manats in 2012 or 2.3% ofnon-oilGDP

title.narrative: Satisfaction of the community with overall access to care increased

comment.narrative: Mean value 3.6 on a scale from one to five, five being the highest (3.7 in the control districts).
Satisfaction increased

Partially achieved. 20% increase in mean value. Although no survey was conducted, based on infrastructure, training and equipmentprovided to the facilities inthe pilot regions, it is expected that satisfaction has been improved (data from LSMS to be verified)

title.narrative: A long-term health sector investment plan prepared as a result of a nationwide mapping of facilities and the subsequent rationalization plan.

comment.narrative: No master plan for guiding the restructuring of the health system network available.

actual.value: Long-term investment plan was prepared and approved

comment.narrative: Achieved

Retraining of health personnel at central and regional level to be conducted under each of project components to strengthen publichealth, clinical, and managerial capacity within the health system.(This indicator was introduced during the midterm review w/outformal restructuring)
Over-achieved.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)

comment.narrative: The rehabilitation, construction, and equipping of health facilities to be done on the basis of Master Plan recommendations forrestructuring health facilities network in pilot regions of the project.(This indicator was introduced during the midterm revieww/out formal restructuring)
8 PHC; 4 village hospitals; 2 district hospitals; 1 maternity hospital reconstructed and equipped.

title.narrative: A White Paper on health is adopted

comment.narrative: non-existent
Achieved. White paper was adopted in 2008

title.narrative: A new health policy and planning unit established

actual.value: HPPU established

comment.narrative: Achieved. The HPPU has played an important role in the certification of the health professionals' process

title.narrative: Infant mortality rate.Under-five mortality rate.Maternal mortality ratio.Underweight prevalence rate in children (<5y).Adult age and cause-specific mortality rates.Self-reported health status

comment.narrative: Indicators have improved

Achieved. Indicators have improved from 2006 to 2012: IM from 11.9 to 11.0; <5M from 16.2 to 13.5; MM from 34.2 to 15.3; LifeExpectancy from 72.4 to 73.6 (Government's statistics). Given the limited coverage of the Project, it is unrealistic to expectmeasurable changes during Project timespan.

title.narrative: Perceived quality of care of the services covered by the BBP by the community increased. (applicable to pilot districts only)

comment.narrative: Increased perceived quality of care covered by BBP
Not achieved. BBP was developed, but not adopted as health financing reforms have stalled.

title.narrative: Household out-of-pocket expenditures for health as a proportion of total health expenditures decreased as a result of free access to essential package of healthcare services. (applicable to pilot dist

comment.narrative: Not achieved. Health financing reform has stalled. Total health spending (~6% of GDP) is close to regional average, but the publicshare is far lower than comparators. As a result, there is a high reliance on private out-of-pocket payments.

title.narrative: Budget allocations to districts is made on the basis of demographic and morbidity criteria. (applicable to pilot districts only)

comment.narrative: Adoption and use of a budget allocation formula.

Partially achieved. Rules of health providers funding in mandatory health insurance (budget allocations) was prepared in 2010 onthe basis of the master plan, but not implemented as financial reform has stalled.

actual.value: MoH functional and administrative structure was reviewed and changes made

comment.narrative: Achieved

title.narrative: Curricula for undergraduate and post-graduate physicians, entrance and graduation criteria for medical degree revised

actual.value: Curricula revised

comment.narrative: Achieved. A strategy for under-graduate medical education was developed and approved as well as a strategy for post-graduatetraining programs. The strategies are being implemented by the Medical University with support of MOH

title.narrative: Proportion of PHC facilities with full staffing and equipment increased

actual.value: Number of PHC facilities increased from 55 to 62, covering 90% of local populations in project districts

comment.narrative: Achieved. All PHC facilities in Project districts are staffed as per standards in the master plan. Essential medical equipmenthasbeen procured under the project and distributed to all PHC facilities in the pilot districts, not only the ones constructedunder the Project.

title.narrative: M&E mechanism is set up and operational

actual.value: M&E mechanism has been set up

comment.narrative: Achieved. Based on the M&E framework, two Health Sector Performance Assessment (HSPA) reports have been produced (2009 and 2011).The first report covers around 44 indicators while the second include also 13 dashboard indicators. With support from the Project,aPatient Discharge Form (Form 66) has been introduced successfully, which allows the government to monitor trends, compareefficiency and quality between facilities and districts.

title.narrative: Standard treatment protocols in the essential BBP developed

actual.value: 40 clinical guidelines and protocols were developed

comment.narrative: Achieved. Extensive training has been supported under the Project in the use of the protocols for over 260 health careprofessionals. The areas include: (i) neonatal care and resuscitation, (ii) antenatal care, and (iii) managing bleeding in labor.

actual.value: HMIS developed and piloted at the hospital level

comment.narrative: Achieved. IT staff has completed a number of system developments and have introduced Form 66 (hospital patient discharge form tohelp monitor trends, compare efficiency and quality among facilities and districts. Modules are being rolled out nationwide.

title.narrative: A White Paper on long-term human resources development is produced and adopted

actual.value: Paper produced and adopted

comment.narrative: Achieved. MOH used recommendations of report for improving the distribution of human resources across the country.

title.narrative: Set of criteria and standards for health facilities developed and adopted

actual.value: Criteria and standards for facilities were developed as part of the master plan

comment.narrative: Achieved. Master plan approved in 2009. In addition, standards were developed for equipment required in different types of healthfacilities

title.narrative: Stakeholder communication and consultation system in place

actual.value: System in place

comment.narrative: Achieved. Public Relations Unit established in MoH. A number of information activities and in the course of thedevelopment/reviewof the master plan conducted a number of workshops in pilot districts to improve understanding and gain thesupport of health authorities and other providers. PIU has collaborated with various international organizations active in thesector in a number of workshops and training activities in various areas.

title.narrative: Standards for continuous medical education and re-certification developed and adopted

actual.value: Standards developed and adopted

comment.narrative: Achieved. Standards include refreshing courses and re-certification of physicians every five years. . 5,587 physicians and 2,321nurses so far have participated in the certification process of which about 95% have been certified. See also comments underIndicator 21.

title.narrative: MoH capacity for disease surveillance and responsiveness improved

target.value: MoH capacity improved on surveillance and responsiveness

actual.value: National strategies for NCDs and CDs have been developed and approved.

comment.narrative: Achieved. Strengthened data collection and assessment of NCDs risk factors have served as the basis for the preparation of aNational Strategy for the prevention and control of NCDs.

title.narrative: Relevant staff trained in various aspects of project management

actual.value: Staff have received training

comment.narrative: Achieved. The Project has financed a number of training seminars and workshops, including project management, procurement,financial management and disbursements. In addition, all Project staff have participated in flagship courses in and outside thecountry.

title.narrative: PHC and hospital based physicians in project districts retrained

comment.narrative: Achieved. Training curriculum for family medicine was developed with technical assistance from Haccetepe University in Turkey andadopted at the AZ Advance Medical Training Institute. Ten physicians and 10 nurses received the training as trainees in Turkey.Thesetrainers are providing training for family physicians and nurses in pilot and neighboring districts thereby ensuringcompliance withthe new skills requirements. In addition, the Project provided in-service trainings for physicians and nurses frompilot districtshospitals in and outside the country. The Medication University has also established a Residency Program

title.narrative: Annual number of visits made to PHC increased

actual.value: Utilization of PHC in the project districts has improved

comment.narrative: Achieved. Utilization improved substantially in two pilot districts where the number of outpatient visits to PHC more than doubled(Agdash and Gakh). Since not all targeted regions show equal improvements further evaluation is needed to get better understandingof these results (data is from 2012 M&E of master plan).

title.narrative: Health facilities rehabilitated and equipped according to master plan

target.value: Health facilities constructed and equipped according to master plan

actual.value: Health facilities constructed and equipped according to master plan

comment.narrative: Achieved.

title.narrative: Proportion of referrals from primary to secondary level of care decreased

target.value: Referrals from PHC to sec. level of care decreased

actual.value: Data not collected

comment.narrative: Not achieved. Data not collected as a number of PHC facilities were recently constructed. This can be measured after Projectcompletion only.

title.narrative: Legal and regulatory framework for licensing, registration and certification of health professionals adopted

actual.value: Legal and regulatory framework was adopted for the implementation of a certification (licensing) process.

comment.narrative: Over-achieved. All trained doctors must pass through the testing and certification process developed with support from theProject.With support from the Project, MOH developed human resource registration software to conduct registration, follow up andplanning ofcertification process.

title.narrative: Mapping of health facilities completed nationwide

actual.value: Mapping of facilities completed after master plan approval

comment.narrative: Over-achieved. Rationalization was implemented in 65 districts. A number of PHC facilities increased by 31% and number ofhospitalbeds decreased by 48%.

actual.value: Several strategic reform policies for pharmaceuticals prepared

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. Draft National Drug Policy, Essential Drug List and Drug Formulary were developed and expected to be adoptedin the near future

title.narrative: Essential package is defined and costed

actual.value: BBP was developed but not costed

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. Delays in political decision regarding the health insurance reform led to delays in approving preliminaryoption on BBP, which was developed.

title.narrative: Scope, type and mix of services at primary and secondary level of care delineated

actual.value: Delineated as part of the draft BBP yet to be approved

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. Implementation of health financing reform has stalled because of political decisions on the placement of theHealth Insurance Fund, which was established on paper but is not operating.

title.narrative: A White Paper on Mandatory Health Insurance (MHI) with various financing and coverage options developed

actual.value: Concept policy on health financing reform and introduction of MHI developed

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. The policy included the main goals for health financing reforms. The Concept and Action Plan were endorsed bythe Cabinet of Ministers and the President in 2008. While the Action Plan was approved and the MHI was established by PresidentialDecree, the MHI has not become operational.

title.narrative: Resource allocation formula developed and adopted for pilot districts

target.value: Resource allocation formula developed and adopted

actual.value: Resource allocation formula developed but not adopted

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. This indicator was redundant.

title.narrative: Project implementation proceeds smoothly and in accordance with PIP

comment.narrative: Substantially achieved. Project implementation has been uneven, but overall it has proceeded smoothly. This relates toimplementation of activities that do not require major policy reforms, such as health financing reforms, which have beenjeopardized by the lack of decision making, including the operationalization of the MHI.
